name: Hardest Which French Football Team is This? Trivia Quiz | Sports | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which club, nicknamed Les Canaris (The Canaries), were eight-times champions of France between 1965 and 2001.
questions.explanation:
FC Nantes.

	FC Nantes were founded in 1943 and their nickname refers to their yellow shirts. They won their first championship in 1965 and their first Coupe de France in 1979. In season 1995-96, they reached the semi-finals of the European Champions League, where they lost narrowly to Italian giants Juventus.

questions.text: Which club, managed by Rene Girad, were the shock winners of the 2011-12 French championship?
questions.explanation:
Montpellier HSC.

	Montpellier HSC were founded in 1919 under their original name of Stade Olympique Montepellerain. They won the Coupe de France in 1929, but spent most of the next few decades yo-yoing between the first and second divisions. The appointment of Girad as manager in 2009 saw the team become serious challengers for honours, and a first-ever league title was won in 2012.

questions.text: Which club reached the final of the very first European Champions Cup in 1956, losing to Real Madrid?
questions.explanation:
Stade de Reims.

	Founded in 1931, Stade de Reims were one of the leading French clubs of the 1950s. Their 1954-55 league title access saw them qualify for the first edition of the European Champions Cup. They made it all the way to the final in Paris, losing to Real Madrid. They reached the final again in 1959, with Real once again being the team who defeated them. Six-times French champions between 1949 and 1962, Reims saw their fortunes decline sharply in the mid 1960s, with much of the next five decades spent outside the top flight.

questions.text: Which team, founded in 1881, are sometimes known as "Les marine et blanc"?
questions.explanation:
Girondins de Bordeaux.

	Girondins de Bordeaux are one of the oldest football teams in France. The "marine et blanc" nickname refers to their navy blue and white strip. The club won six league titles between 1950 and 2009, and reached the final of the 1995-96 UEFA Cup, where they lost to Bayern Munich.

questions.text: Which club, winners of the 1995-96 European Cup Winners' Cup, won a record eleventh Coupe de France in 2017, and were champions in four successive seasons between 2013 and 2016?
questions.explanation:
Paris Saint-Germain.

	PSG were formed as recently as 1970, and made their top-flight debut in 1973. Their first Coupe de France was won in 1982, with their first league championship following in 1986. In 1996, they defeated Rapid Vienna in the final of the European Cup Winners' Cup. In 2011, the club were bought by a Qatari group who invested heavily in world class players, with the result that PSG started to dominate French football and contest the later stages of the Champions League on a regular basis.

questions.text: Which club, in 1993, became the first French team to win the European Champions Cup/League?
questions.explanation:
Olympique de Marseille.

	Olympique de Marseille were founded in 1899, and won their first major honour, the Coup de France, in 1924. Their first league title followed in 1937. The appointment of Bernard Tapie as club president in 1986 saw the club attract numerous star players from home and abroad, and they dominated French football in the late 1980s/early 90s. In 1993, they reached the final of the European Champions League, beating AC Milan in the final. A match-fixing scandal shortly afterwards saw them demoted to the second division and they didn't win another major honour until they won the league in 2010.

questions.text: Which club, one of the most dominant in French football in the 1940s/50s, came back to prominence in 2011 with their third league championship success?
questions.explanation:
Lille OSC.

	Lille OSC were formed in 1944 by the merger of Olympique Lillois and SC Fives. In the first decade of their existence they won two league titles and five French cups. The club then faded into relative obscurity until the early 21st century when they became regular entrants in the European Champions League and Europa League. In 2010-11 they recorded a famous league and cup double.

questions.text: The dominant club in French football throughout much of the 1960s and 70s, which team reached the 1976 European Champions Cup final, where they lost to Bayern Munich?
questions.explanation:
AS Saint-Etienne.

	AS Saint-Etienne were founded in 1919, but didn't win their first major honour until the 1957 league title. Their golden era was between 1964 and 1976 when seven championships were annexed. In 1977, they reached the European Champions Cup final, losing to Bayern Munich at Hampden Park in Glasgow. The club's 1981 league title was their last of the 20th century.

questions.text: Which club won a then-record seventh consecutive French league title in 2008?
questions.explanation:
Olympique Lyonnais.

	Olympique Lyonnais were formed in 1950 and won their first major honour, the Coupe de France, in 1964. They didn't win their first league title until 2002, but this was to be the start of a remarkable run that saw them win seven-in-a-row. In 2010, they reached the semi-finals of the European Champions League for the first time, where they lost to Bayern Munich.

questions.text: Which team won eight league titles between 1961 and 2017 and reached the final of the 2004 European Champions League?
questions.explanation:
AS Monaco.

	AS Monaco were formed in 1924, and, although based in the Principality of Monaco, have always played their football in the French league system. They reached the top tier for the first time in 1953 and won their first championship in 1961. They were beaten finalists in the 1991-92 European Cup Winners Cup, losing to Werder Bremen, and were runners-up to FC Porto in the 2003-04 Champions League.
